cyclone.name: OPHELIA
cyclone.category: Potential Tropical Cyclone / Tropical Depression (≤39 mph)
cyclone.current_location: about 345 miles SE of Charleston, SC, and 415 miles S of Cape Hatteras, NC
cyclone.trajectory: moving north to north-northwest, expected to turn toward the North Carolina coast and then progress inland up the Mid-Atlantic
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central North Carolina coast between Cape Fear and Cape Lookout

weather_observation.watch_coast: Surf City NC to Duck NC, Chesapeake Bay north of Windmill Point to Smith Point, Tidal Potomac south of Colonial Beach, remainder Albemarle & Pamlico Sounds
weather_observation.warning_coast: Cape Fear NC to Fenwick Island DE, Albemarle & Pamlico Sounds, Tidal Potomac south of Cobb Island, Chesapeake Bay south of North Beach
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southeastern North Carolina through the entire Mid-Atlantic coastline
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (35–45 mph with higher gusts) possible Friday night through Saturday in the Wilmington area.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 1–3 ft inundation possible along the lower Cape Fear River and adjacent beaches south of Surf City.
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy rainfall of 3–5 inches with locally higher totals, bringing a risk of flash and urban flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents beginning Friday; isolated tornadoes cannot be ruled out Friday night–Saturday.
